instruction.title: Get to Know the Library
instruction.description: Introduction to library staff and services
learning_outcomes: identify their personal librarian
understand the basic range of library services

instruction.title: Background Knowledge
instruction.description: Find broad information on a topic and identify facts and sub-topics
learning_outcomes: Search the library to find reference sources
Use advanced features reference databases
Understand the place of reference resources within the research process
activities: On a piece of paper, students create Mind-Map using their topic/research question
Students find information from a reference source, like Credo or Gale databases, based on terms from the Mind-Map they have created

instruction.title: Basic HoyaSearch
instruction.description: Use HoyaSearch to find and obtain books, articles, and other online resources
learning_outcomes: Search for and find physical books
Understand how to use an item's call number to locate it within the library
Search for and access online materials such as articles and e-books
activities: Students search and find books and articles  based on their research question. If the class is conducted in the library, students can roam the shelves to locate print material.

instruction.title: Develop a Research Question
instruction.description: Use library resources to formulate and/or narrow a research topic
learning_outcomes: Formulate a focused, clear, relevant research question
activities: Students are asked to write their research question on a piece of paper or Google Docs, and examine if it passes the criteria of a well-formulated research question.

instruction.title: Advanced HoyaSearch
instruction.description: Develop a search strategy using the advanced features of HoyaSearch
learning_outcomes: break down a research question and extract concepts
Find related keywords using reference sources
Combine search terms
Search HoyaSearch for a variety of content (e- Book, peer-reviewed articles, etc.)
Locate and download the full text
Apply subject terms
Copy citations from
activities: The librarian asks students to find at least x number of sources related to their research question using the advanced tools in HoyaSearch

instruction.title: Expert Google Scholar
instruction.description: Go beyond simple searching and use Google Scholar as a strategic research tool
learning_outcomes: Make use the advanced search feature of Google Scholar
Apply forward and backward citation search
Learn how to export citations individually and as a list
Learn how to connect Google Scholar to the Georgetown University libraries to use integration tools
Learn how to refine search results from within the list of results
activities: Students are asked to complete a handout with advanced search prompts and then export the citations from the articles they found

instruction.title: Evaluate Information Sources
instruction.description: Evaluate online information using the CRAAP method (Currency, Relevance, Authority, Accuracy, and Purpose)
learning_outcomes: Evaluate information sources for Currency, Relevance, Authority, Accuracy and Purpose
Distinguish between scholarly and popular sources
activities: Activity where students will need to evaluate sources based on CRAAP evaluation criteria

instruction.title: Primary Sources
instruction.description: What are primary sources and how to locate them
learning_outcomes: Define what is a primary source
Use the library and the internet to locate primary sources
Distinguish between primary and secondary sources
activities: Students are given samples of different types of primary and secondary sources and must identify them properly

instruction.title: Searching for News
instruction.description: Use specialized library databases for news sources
learning_outcomes: Locate newspaper and magazine articles using HoyaSearch
Search specialized databases for newspaper and magazine content including Factiva, Nexis Uni, and ProQuest Historical Newspapers
activities: Students are given a topic and must find news resources from one of the library's news databases

instruction.title: Refworks/Zotero
instruction.description: How to use citation tools to organize and speed up the research process
learning_outcomes: Add/grab/export references from HoyaSearch, Google Scholar or other websites
Organize references by folders
Cite while they write
Create bibliography
Share references
activities: Students find a source from HoyaSearch and a library database and export the citation successfully using either RefWorks or Zotero
Students are given a citation by the library and must import and edit it so it is correct

instruction.title: Subject Database Search
instruction.description: Use specialized databases according to subject and content needed
learning_outcomes: Identify database type based on information need (datasets, images, peer-reviewed journals, primary sources, and more)
Use advanced search features and techniques
activities: Students will use the database(s) to find materials according to their research topic
Students compare two or more databases or information sources for their usefulness

instruction.title: Citing Properly
instruction.description: Understand the mechanics of proper citations and where to find guidelines on different citation standards
learning_outcomes: Know where to look for assistance with citation
Read citations
Find system generated citations and correct the mistakes, if any
Understand what copyright is, why itâ€™s important, and when it is applicable (ex. Public domain vs. common knowledge)
activities: Use library resources to find system generated citations and correct the mistakes, if any

instruction.title: Multimedia and Copyright Guidelines
instruction.description: Importance of copyright and how to apply it to multimedia content
learning_outcomes: Learn the concepts of owned copyright, public domain, licensing statements, and Fair Use
Navigate specialized library databases for multimedia content
Navigate and evaluate an assortment of open access multimedia databases for multimedia content
Understand the unique aspects of copyright and multimedia content
activities: Librarian presents a multimedia source and students state how copyright may be applied either as an owned copyright, public domain, licensing statement, Fair Use

instruction.title: Data and Dataset searching
learning_outcomes: Use specialized library databases to find datasets according to information need
Find, evaluate and use openly accessible datasets
Explore data visualization options
activities: Students must identify and export a dataset from databases such as database like Statista or the World Bank

instruction.title: Literature Review
instruction.description: Understand the concept of a literature review and how it is structured
learning_outcomes: Evaluate scope of research question
Use HoyaSearch to find materials
Use other techniques to discover materials: reference sources, forward/ backward citation search, browsing
Evaluate sources for authority and relevance
Understand the value of a citation tool for carrying out a literature review
activities: Librarian asks students to explain the major goals and components of a literatures
